title: Building Credit
author: Rylie Lane
text:
Credit is the ability to spend more money than you have understanding that you will pay it off in the future. 
## Benefits and Consequences:
- banks trust you more with good credit
- banks trust you less with bad credit
- building credit takes time 
- Forces you to look at money differently as a whole
- have to stay on top of more bills

Number to call to get your credit score: [555-555-5555](tel:+1-555-555-5555)


## Building credit 
Topic 1 (Will has)
- Paying off debt
- How to get started and where

Topic 2 (Will has)
- what do I do when I get paid
- advise against 

## Topic #3
The most well-known credit score is the Fair Isaac Cooperation, or FICO. How old your accounts are and how well you pay your loans are the main factors in your credit score. Other factors include how much you owe, amounts of accounts owned, and what they are paying for. FICO credit scores are 300 and 850. The higher the score, the better credit you have. 

## Topic 4
There are many ways to build a good credit score. Some ways include paying off bills on time, never going past about a quarter of your card limit, using credit cards every now and then, owning less cards, and looking at your credit score every year. Building credit takes time and you need to be patient
